content.question: Which of the following is not a minor triad?

choices.label: The pitches B-flat2, F3, D-flat4, and B-flat4 are notated on a grand staff.
The pitches B-flat2, D3, B-flat3, and F4 are notated on a grand staff.
The pitches D-flat3, B-flat3, B-flat3, and F4 are notated on a grand staff.
The pitches D-flat3, F3, B-flat3, and D-flat4 are notated on a grand staff.

content.answer: The pitches B-flat2, D3, B-flat3, and F4 are notated on a grand staff.

unit.text: 3: Music Fundamentals III - Triads and Seventh Chords

topic.text: 3.1: Triad and Chord Qualities (M, m, d, A)

skill.text: Skill 2.A: Use symbols and terms to describe features of pitch in notated music, including pitch patterns and relationships, melodic features, chords, harmonic progressions, and cadences.
